author: ondkami

comment:
I totally agree that it's a bare minimum, perfunctory response, that he would have felt obligated to post. 

That being the case though, I actually think that his choosing to post only that, says quite a bit more than not posting at all would have. No response says nothing either way; an unknown variable. An enthusiastic response would obviously indicate support. But this, this is about as far as you can go to from support without crossing into outright condemnation. 

While I agree that he has the clout to comment at will, maybe things like WB firing even big names like JD, might make him second guess that fact. I don't like it, and I've condemned his silence before. But this isn't silence. In fact, in its own way, it's a rebellion, his way of chafing against WB's muzzle. What isn't included, what isn't said, conveys a whole hell of a lot. 

And one irrefutable thing about Mamoa, is that he values family immensely. And, if I can see that her choosing to bring a child into this toxic mess in absolutely no way considers what would be best or even healthy for a child; you can bet he sees that too. I would go so far as to guess (and it is just a guess) that, even if he had believed her, or even just accepted all her other mistakes until now, etc., he'd see this one quite differently. In making this choice, she has given away the narcissism we've all already known about by showing everyone else her true disregard for the well-being of others, including, in particular, the well-being of innocent children.

Note: Oonagh = [oon] as in " *moon* ", and [a] as in " *Uh* , wait. What do you mean someone allowed " *a* " proven, confessed, narcissistic, and serial,  domestic violence perpetrator  to take "possession" (because you know that's how she sees it) of an innocent child?"
